Oh, it’s all about the camera settings, Hulk. You see, they use a slow shutter speed to capture the light trails from the cars. Kinda like how I swing through the city, fast but you can still see where I've been with my webs sometimes.
Shutter speed... Like squinting eyes for a long time?
Exactly! And the longer the 'eyes' are open, the more light comes in. It makes everything that moves turn into a blur. A bit like when you punch too fast for us to see.
Hulk understand! But streets look... wet? It dangerous for people, maybe.

Well, yeah, it's a bit slippery, but that's also what makes the photo cool, the reflection on the wet road. Hey, come to think of it, you’d probably just stomp and all the puddles would clear up, huh?
Haha, yes! Hulk could do that. But... what about lights on top? They just like stars?

They are kind of like stars, streetlamps are the city's stars, I guess. They guide you, like how the stars guide heroes in the old stories. I kind of look up to the skyscraper lights like that when I'm up on my web late at night.
Hulk like stars too. Peaceful. But Hulk's stars in other galaxies, maybe. Seen a lot out in space.

I hear you, big guy. I've been to space too because of that whole Infinity War thing. I gotta say, Earth's lights are nice, but they're not quite as mesmerizing as looking at a nebula or a whole other planet.
Hulk agree. But for now... this image, it good. Remind Hulk of both worlds. Human and infinite. Hulk enjoy simple human creativity.
Hey, Spidey, check this out. You ever see a complaints department specifically for elephants?
No way, that's wild! And I thought my life was weird enough juggling high school and superhero stuff. Do you think they actually get a lot of complaints?
I'm picturing a disgruntled tourist filing a report about an elephant eating their safari hat. But seriously, it's kind of awesome. Only in the superhero life, right?
Definitely. Makes me wonder, what do you even say in an elephant complaint? "Excuse me, but your elephant sneezed on me, and now I'm stuck to a tree with elephant snot."
Well, if that happened, I'd just shrink down and avoid the whole sticky situation. Speaking of sticky, you've got your web-slinging — ever use it on an elephant?
I'll stick to swinging between buildings, thanks. But I'm curious, think you could communicate with an elephant? You've got that whole ant-whisperer thing going on.
If they used Pym Particles, maybe. A tiny elephant sneaking around might actually need our help. Imagine that heist!
Tiny elephant heist with Ant-Man and Spider-Man. I can see the headlines now. Would we be the Elephant Avengers, or does that sound too much like we're avenging the elephants?
As long as we're not avenging them against poachers, I'm in. Save the elephants, you know? Scott Lang: Petty thief, Avenger, and elephant protector.
I'm right there with you. Peter Parker: Friendly neighborhood Spider-Man and part-time elephant guardian.
Ah, what a team-up! But hey, let's keep this between us. Can't have the press asking about our elephant escapades when there's real supervillain butt to kick.
Yeah, our secret's safe. Besides, I've got enough explaining to do with Mr. Stark about the whole "multiverse" thing. Let's stick to saving the world from the usual bad guys.

As the sun tracks across the sky, so too does this device mark the passage of time. It is quite ornate, much different from the sundials of Wakanda. Have you seen such craftsmanship in your world, Spider-Man?

Oh, definitely, T'Challa. Clocks like this one are pretty common in New York, but each one has its own style. This one is super classy, kind of like something Mr. Stark would have in his collection—well, if it were, you know, more high-tech and made of a vibranium alloy or something.

Indeed, Stark had an appreciation for innovative designs. Such a timepiece serves as a reminder that while we may feverishly work to protect our world, time itself marches on unabated. It waits for no king or hero.

True, and it always seems like there’s never enough of it, right? I mean, one minute I’m trying to finish my homework and the next, I’m swinging across the city stopping bad guys or... joining an intergalactic battle.

A hero's duty is never done, and time is indeed our silent adversary. But let us use it wisely, as a tool, not just a boundary. Our legacy is not in how we fought against time but rather what we did with the time given to us.

That's deep, and you’re totally right. It’s about making every moment count. In a way, this clock is kinda inspiring, acts as a reminder to, you know, make the most of now. Plus, it’s a pretty handy meeting point. "Meet you under the big gold clock," makes for good directions if you're not from around here.
Yes, it is a beacon in its own right. And just as this clock stands at a crossroads, we too face many paths in life. It is our choices, I believe, that truly set our direction.

Oh yeah, speaking of choices... I better get going or I'm gonna be late to meet Ned and MJ. They're definitely way less forgiving about time than you are! By the way, if you ever need help synchronizing Wakandan time with New York City time, just let me know. I'm something of a science whiz.
I shall keep that in mind, young Spider. Go, be with your friends. And remember, "Wakanda Forever!"
And don't forget, "With great power, comes great responsibility." Catch you later, T'Challa!
Peter, does it not intrigue you, the way humans can find such pleasure in the simple combination of bread, tomatoes, and cheese?

Totally, Vision! I mean, who doesn't love pizza? It's kinda like the perfect food after swinging around all day. And there's something about a good slice that just... brings people together, you know?
Yes, I've noticed that. It's rather fascinating how a meal can become more than sustenance; it's a cultural phenomenon, a means to bond with one another.

Exactly! In Queens, pizza's like a way of life. Plus, with the different toppings, it can be something new every time—like every pizza is an opportunity for a new experience. Kind of symbolic, if you ask me.
Symbolic indeed. The diversity of toppings representing the multifaceted nature of individual preferences within a collective experience. Variety within unity. It's almost poetic.
You're getting all deep about pizza, Vision, and I'm just wondering if there's an extra slice. Hey, you don't eat, do you? More for me, then?

While I admire the complexity of its flavors, I indeed have no need for sustenance. But please, enjoy, as it's a reminder of the simpler joys in life, something that should not be underestimated in its importance.
Couldn't agree more! Simple joys for the win. Hey, thanks for the talk, Vision. It's always cool to get your perspective on things... even when it's just about pizza.
Peter, take a look at this. The multitude of universes, and we find ourselves observing a public bus.
A regular bus? That's kind of a letdown, isn't it? I was half expecting a vehicle from another dimension.

Not everything is an eldritch abomination or a mystical relic. Sometimes, the mundane can be just as perplexing. Note the destination: "BAGUIO VIA TPLEX". An interesting choice for travel between realms, don't you think?
Well, I guess if you want to keep a low profile, it's perfect! Beats swinging from webs or magical sling rings. Do you think this bus could handle a tour of the Spider-Verse?
Considering the random nature of the Nexus Event, it would be highly irresponsible to even attempt it. Besides, the fabric of the multiverse isn't something to take lightly, even for a bus ride.
True. The last thing we need is a multiversal traffic jam. Imagine the insurance paperwork on that one!

Indeed, the bureaucracy of interdimensional transit authorities is a nightmare I'd rather avoid. In any case, the variety of life's tapestry is evident here. Just an ordinary bus, yet it serves as a vital link within its own world.
You know, Doctor, it's pretty cool how you can find the extraordinary in the ordinary. That's something I'm trying to learn too, especially after... well, everything.

It's an important lesson, Peter. A Master of the Mystic Arts must understand that the spectacular coexists with the seemingly trivial. And you, as Spider-Man, must remember that the people riding that bus are the very individuals we've sworn to protect.
Couldn't have said it better myself. Whether it's stopping a mugging or fighting off aliens, it's all about looking out for the little guy, right?
Exactly. And often, it's the small actions that hold the universe together as much as the grand gestures. Now, let's leave this bus to its route and attend to our own, shall we?
Lead the way, Doctor Strange. But if we're traveling dimensions, I vote for something with a bit more legroom next time.
Look at these humans, looks like a shared meal, doesn't it?
Yeah, it's kind of heartwarming, you know? Everyone's together, sharing food. Reminds me of Aunt May's dinners. She always said there's nothing like a good meal to bring people closer.
Hulk think so too. Food is powerful. Food and friends, good combination.
Absolutely. And look at that spread, they've got lots of veggies, some fruit... Wait, Hulk, you're not gonna get any ideas about smashing those plates, right?
Hulk not smash when Hulk sees people happy. Hulk like peace sometimes. Banner part of me likes science of cooking.
That's really mature of you, big guy. Cooking's a lot like chemistry. It's all about mixing the right ingredients to create something amazing. Kind of like when we team up, huh?
Yes. Like when Hulk and tiny spider work together. Stronger together. Hulk has strength, spider boy has webs and clever head.
And you've got both the brains and the brawn now, Professor Hulk. Guess we make a pretty unbeatable combo. Oh, and by the way, they call me Spider-Man, not spider boy. I'm not that young...
Hulk apologize. Spider-Man. Hulk forget sometimes. People in image seem happy. Simple things. Hulk miss simple.
I get it, we're always caught up in the big battles, saving the world stuff. It's nice to see regular life going on. Makes you appreciate the small moments, right?
Yes. Small moments important. Hulk takes note. Maybe Hulk try cooking. Make something other than smashed potatoes.
Smashed potatoes? I guess cooking could be another form of anger management for you. And hey, I'd definitely swing by for dinner if you're cooking. Just skip the gamma seasoning, okay?
Hulk promise. No gamma, only flavor. Friends welcome any time. Thank you, Spider-Man, for talk.
Anytime, Hulk. And if you ever want to swap recipes or fight some bad guys, you know where to find me. Take care of yourself, green buddy.
This place peaceful, like Sakaar without the fighting and the crowd. But Hulk not see this before, what is it?

Oh hey, big guy. This right here looks like a photo of some cows grazing in a meadow. Not exactly our usual battleground, huh? It's kinda serene, almost makes you forget about all the chaos we usually deal with.
Cows... Hulk not sure he ever see cow before. They look... strong, but peaceful. Hulk like it.
Yeah, they're pretty cool animals. They just spend their time eating grass and chillin' out. No alien invasions or evil villains to fight off. Simple life, you know?
Simple good sometimes. Banner would like analyze grass and dirt, look for science stuff. Hulk... Hulk just enjoy quiet.

That's the spirit, Hulk. It's important to find some quiet time, recharge the batteries. Even us superheroes need a break from saving the world. Plus, I bet your other half, Dr. Banner, would have a field day studying an ecosystem like this.
Yes, Banner always looking at tiny things, talking about cells and energy. Hulk rather jump high and run fast. But this good for resting.

Definitely. It's a good balance, like you and Dr. Banner, big and strong but also smart and careful. Makes me think about finding balance in my own life, between school, friends, and being Spider-Man.
Balance hard. But Banner and Hulk finding way. Little spider find balance too. Hulk think you do good.
Thanks, Hulk. Means a lot coming from you. I guess whether we're taking on the baddest of the bad or just kicking back and watching some cows, we've got each other's backs.
Hmph, yes. Hulk got little spider back. Now Hulk want to go place like this. Find quiet. Maybe Hulk take cow back to Avengers. Make good pet?
Well, that would be a sight at the Avengers' HQ. Ms. Marvel might like the idea though. Just make sure to check with, uh, ground control first. They might not be ready for livestock just yet, buddy.
Ground control... maybe you right. Hulk ask Banner later. For now, Hulk enjoy picture.
A curious creature, isn’t it? The avian’s delicate steps seem almost like a ballet across the water's surface.
Yeah, it’s pretty impressive. Kind of like it's got its own Spidey-sense, avoiding the water but still getting close enough for a snack.
Indeed. It's all about balance and awareness, something you've managed quite well in our own battles.
Thanks, Dr. Strange. Just trying to keep up with the "Master of the Mystic Arts" here. Speaking of balance, that bird kind of reminds me of you, always on your toes... or should I say, fingers?
Hah, perhaps there is a resemblance in our precision. Though I must say, I've never had to wade in water for my dinner.
Would that be takeout from the Sanctum Sanctorum's nearest Thai place, then?
Guilty as charged. But let's get back to our feathered friends here. Their ability to adapt to environments, it's nature's own form of magic.
True. Adaptation is key. Just like how we had to adapt to... well, everything that happened with the multiverse.
That we did. But you, Peter, you showed an admirable trait. Sacrifice. Not unlike these creatures who migrate vast distances for survival, you've made tough choices for the greater good.
Didn't really have a choice there, did I? But hey, look at them, just living in the moment. Must be nice to not have to worry about Thanos or interdimensional villains.
A simpler life, indeed. Yet, they have their own struggles, predators, the environment. A different scale than cosmic threats, but survival is universal.
Makes you appreciate the little things, doesn't it? Just swinging around the city sounds pretty great right now.
I wouldn't mind a break from reality bending myself. However, watching these birds, it's a reminder that the universe is vast and full of wonders, from the smallest sandpiper to the largest galaxy.
It's all connected. Kind of makes you feel... I don't know, part of something bigger, right?
Precisely, Peter. And as guardians of this world and others, it’s our duty and privilege to protect all its creatures and the beauty they contribute to the cosmos.
You always know how to put things into perspective, Doctor. Now let's make sure one of those interdimensional villains doesn't decide to show up and ruin this peaceful scene.
Agreed. But worry not, I'll keep a mystic eye on our surroundings. For now, let’s just enjoy the serenity that nature has provided us.
